snippet: Argentina said the world’s No. 1 household products maker was hiding income and overbilling $138 million in imports to get money out of the country.
abstract: Argentina accuses Procter & Gamble of tax fraud, saying firm is hiding income and overbilling $138 million in imports to get money out of the country.
lead_paragraph: Argentina said the world’s No. 1 household products maker was hiding income and overbilling $138 million in imports to get money out of the country.

headline.main: Procter & Gamble Accused of Tax Fraud by Argentina
headline.print_headline: Procter & Gamble Accused of Tax Fraud by Argentina
